availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jason H. M. Billington (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Phoebe Billington. Married to Louisa Billington. Father of Hiram Billington, Janet Billington, and Garthena Billington. Farmer in McCracken County, Kentucky, in 1850. Master mason in the Lovelaceville Lodge, No. 157, in 1860. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 163B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, pp. 714-715.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 3, p. 394A.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, Held in the City of Louisville, on Monday, the 16th Day of October, 1860 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co., 1860), p. 133.
